required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-life Use of Niraparib in a Patient Access Program in Norway
clinical_study.official_title: Real-life Use of Niraparib in a Patient Access Program in Norway

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective observational study of patients treated with niraparib in an individual patient access program in Norway.

detailed_description.textblock: Poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase (PARP) inhibitors have emerged as new treatment options in ovarian cancer. While there is now also evidence for the efficacy in the first line setting, they were initially studied in recurrent disease both as maintenance after chemotherapy but also as treatment on its own. The NOVA study was conducted in the maintenance setting of patients with recurrent high-grade serous ovarian-, tube or peritoneal cancer who had responded to platinum-based chemotherapy. In 2017 Tesaro opened an individual patient access program in Norway, and in July 2017 the first Norwegian patient was enrolled. We performed a retrospective observational study of patients treated with niraparib in the individual patient access program in Norway. The objective of the study is to provide preliminary efficacy and safety data in a rather unselected population of non-gBRCA patients with recurrent ovarian-, tube-, or peritoneal cancer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months
primary_outcome.description: Date of start of niraparib to start date of subsequent treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 18.5 months
secondary_outcome.description: Date of start niraparib to date of investigator assessed progression

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to progression assesed by CA-125
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 18.5 months
secondary_outcome.description: Date of start niraparib to date of 2xUNL CA-125

secondary_outcome.measure: Type of subsequent chemotherapy if applicable
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Response to subsequent chemotherapy (investigator assessed, measured as ORR and CBR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months
secondary_outcome.description: Response to subsequent chemotherapy (investigator assessed, measured as ORR and CBR

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with at least one grade 3 and 4 hematologic and non-hematologic toxicity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with at least one grade 3 and 4 hematologic and non-hematologic toxicity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months
Through study completion, an average of 15 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Reasons for discontinuation (i.e. toxicity, progressive disease, patient preferences, other)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months
secondary_outcome.description: Reasons for discontinuation (i.e. toxicity, progressive disease, patient preferences, other)

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare progression-free survival data in groups by CA 125 at baseline (normalized vs not normalized)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 15 months
secondary_outcome.description: Compare progression-free survival data in groups by CA 125 at baseline (normalized vs not normalized)

intervention.description: Niraparib provided through the patient access program

study_pop.textblock: Patients with relapsed ovarian, fallopian tube or peritoneum cancer in response to platinum based chemotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients enrolled in the individual patient access program since 2017.
- Patients who have received at least one dose of niraparib will be included.
- Patients will be identified and recruited from the following participating sites: Oslo University Hospital, Haukeland University Hospital, Stavanger University Hospital, St. Olavs Hospital, University Hospital of Northern Norway and SÃ¸rlandet sykehus.
